newsitem.title: USA: Parametric EPS guidance below Alex. Brown estimates. [CORRECTED 20:00 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Parametric EPS guidance below Alex. Brown estimates. [CORRECTED 20:00 GMT]

text.p: Shares of Parametric Technology Corp slipped about 10 percent after the company offered guidance on fiscal 1998 earnings estimates that was below Alex Brown expectations. (Corrects headline and text to show guidance was below Alex Brown expectations, not Wall Street consensus estimate.

Alex. Brown analyst Philip Rueppel issued a research statement on Parametric Friday morning, saying the Waltham, Mass.-based company's guidance on earnings was lower than analysts' expectations, Rueppel's office said.
Parametric lost 5-1/4 to 42-1/8 and was one of the most heavily traded Nasdaq issues.
Rueppel's office said additional details were not immediately available.
Parametric officials could not be reached for comment.

According to First Call, analysts expect Parametric to earn $0.42 a share in the third quarter ending in June, compared to $0.31 a share a year ago. For the full year, analysts expect the company to earn $1.65 a share, compared to $1.19 a share last year.
Parametric develops software products used for the mechanical computer-aided design, manufacturing and engineering industries.
